Back-to-back league victories against Gateshead and Histon have left Minstermen supporters dreaming of a return to the Football League

An eventful week for the Minstermen, which yielded a win and a defeat, ended with a 1-1 draw with Hayes and Yeading United on Saturday

Alcuin too strong for Vanbrugh in memorable College Cup final

Alcuin claimed the College Cup on Monday evening, beating Vanbrugh 3-1 in an end-to-end final. (Thumbnail credit Photos: George Lowther)

Scott undaunted by York Sport challenge

Sports Editor Adam Shergold finds the incoming York Sport President in a confident mood as she prepares to take the reins from Alex Lacy next week

The College Cup: Tournament Review

Turmoil in Iran, the economy in the doldrums, the retirement of Tugay: in many ways this term has been a torrid interlude in the usually blissful reverie that is life in the 21st Century. But, as the tempestuous waves of world events crash all around us, the College Cup has kept everyone entertained. (Thumbnail credit Cup magic)

The Mixer

Tucking into our chicken, erm, 'supreme', having blagged our way, Gordon Brown-like, onto the top table, TM takes in the surroundings of the York Sport Dinner.

Rowers miss out at prestigious Henley Regatta

York's senior men's squad narrowly missed out on qualifying for the finals of Henley Royal Regatta last Friday, a feat only achieved three times in the history of the university. (Thumbnail credit Photograph: The four at Doncaster recently. By Irene Sieberger )

College Cup final date decided

The College Cup final between Alcuin and Vanbrugh will take place on Monday Week 10 at 6.00pm on the JLD astroturf. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Arran Bowen-la Grange)

Alex Lacy's Final Word

Alex Lacy, outgoing York Sport President, reflects on his year in office (Thumbnail credit Photo: George Lowther)

The College Cup Final Preview Show

Looking forward to the final of the college cup? Nouse and YSTV have a preview show, with interviews, highlights of the semis and a team of panellists discussing the pending match.

Final beckons for Alcuin after Derwent's cup dreams disintegrate

Alcuin will face Vanbrugh in the final of the College Cup after an excellent performance saw them beat Derwent 3-1 on the astroturf today. (Thumbnail credit Photos: George Lowther)

Success for Boat Club on three fronts

The University Boat Club rounded off their season with encouraging results at Henley, Marlow and York regattas last weekend (Thumbnail credit Photograph: Rebecca Jayne Dobinson, Henley)

Cup Dreamz: semi-finals with the prodigal predictor

He's back...with a bang. Dreamz Murphy provides the most cutting insights into the College Cup semi-finals in his regular predictor column. (Thumbnail credit The world of predictions' prodigal son returns for the semi-finals (Photo: Arran Bowen-la Grange))

York Sport Awards shortlists announced

The final shortlists have been released for the annual York Sport Awards, to be presented next Friday (Thumbnail credit Picture: Justyn Hardcastle)

Polo Club make their mark at National Championships

The University Polo Club travelled to Leamington Spa for their National Championships last weekend (Thumbnail credit Jess Grundy in action - Photo: Steph Ritchie, UY Polo Club)

Johnson double sees off Derwent Seconds

Two first-half Mark Johnson goals and a brilliant Mark McLeod curler saw off a spirited fight from Derwent Seconds today to book James a place in the semi-finals of the College Cup. (Thumbnail credit Photo: George Lowther)

Late Cox strike sends Alcuin into semis

Alcuin march onto the semi-finals of the College Cup after a late strike by Dan Cox consigned Halifax to defeat. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Arran Bowen-la Grange)

Penalties help Vanbrugh send depleted Goodricke out of Cup

Goalkeeper Paul Taylor went from villain to hero today as Vanbrugh beat Goodricke on penalties to progress to the semi-finals. (Thumbnail credit Photo: George Lowther)

Derwent stride into the semis after dispatching Alcuin 2s

The College Cup semi-finals beckon for favourites Derwent Firsts after they comprehensively outplayed Alcuin Seconds in a 3-0 win today. (Thumbnail credit Photo: George Lowther)

College Cup Round-up: Matchweek 5

Nouse looks back on an incredible final week of group-stage action in the College Cup, as Alcuin Seconds steal an unexpected place in the quarter-finals and Vanbrugh pull a rabbit out of the hat to beat Derwent. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Arran Bowen-la Grange)

Cup Dreamz: the prodigal predictor

Dreamz Murphy reveals his own unique take on the College Cup quarter-finals, and predicts the winners and losers as the competition heats up for a grand-stand finale. (Thumbnail credit The outspoken man about campus, Dreamz Murphy unveils words of timeless Cup widom. (Arran Bowen-la Grange))

College Cup quarter-final matchups decided

The teams and dates for the College Cup quater-final matches have been decided after the final group matches were played today. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Vanbrugh scrape through after Prince double sinks Derwent

An Ali Prince brace was enough to book Vanbrugh Firsts a place in the quarter-finals after they edged their must-win game against Derwent Firsts 2-1 yesterday. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Langwith scare Goodricke in compelling final group matches

Monday's games saw Langwith produce an incredible display in a 3-2 loss to one of the tournament favourites in Goodricke, and Alcuin and Derwent Seconds secure a place in the quarter-finals. (Thumbnail credit Arran Bowen-la Grange)

MCC prove too strong for York in prestige end-of-season match

After a disappointing season, featuring both relegation from BUCS League 2B and a premature cup exit, a fixture against the world-famous Marylebone Cricket Club bought some cheer to the bedraggled first team faces out on the 22 Acres last Sunday. (Thumbnail credit After the visiting MCC reached 266-4 batting first, as custom dictates, York struggled to gain enough momentum against slow bowlers, eventually falling 32 runs short.)

Optimism for rowers after double-header

he University of York Boat Club experienced mixed fortunes this weekend at the Peterborough Regatta, where they were unable to win any categories outright but did manage to achieve two podium finishes. (Thumbnail credit The York women's senior eights, pictured here leading Sheffield Boat Club in the Doncaster regatta)

Sailing and Windsurfing Club

Sports Editor Adam Shergold spends a day learning the ropes with a club which looks after members past and present and has positioned itself for an assault on honours in the future. (Thumbnail credit Action from Roses 2009, where York completed a clean sweep of the podium places in all events )
